primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God judges His people for their idolatry through exile, but then sovereignly acts to redeem them for His own sake, transforming their suffering into a light for the nations.

tekstueel_bewijs: I will hurl you out of this land
I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions for my own sake
I have redeemed you ... you are mine

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the People
tekstueel_bewijs: God has accepted the tears and prayers of his exiled people
he is preparing a highway in the desert for their return

zender.identificatie: The Holiness and Sovereignty of God
tekstueel_bewijs: I am the Lord, and there is no other
the Lord of hosts is his name
Israel will become a light to the nations
to all of you who sometimes feel that you are in exile

helper.identificatie: The Prophets (Jeremiah, Second Isaiah) and the Suffering Servant
tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all
the voice we hear is the voice of God
they cannot save. They have no power.
a rampaging army from an utterly foreign place
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but 'theological emergency'—false gods that seduce but cannot deliver life.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The faithful remnant (Daniel, etc.) responding to God through prayer and confession while in exile.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Faithful Remnant
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human response is depicted as a result of the 'theological emergency' but is ultimately superseded by God's sovereign 'new thing'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we refused to play the games
we seek the city which is to come

voorbeelden: you are going to have to serve false gods
Nobody wants to hear what the second group has to say
They knew they did not deserve God’s help

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Inability' of man and false gods versus the 'Ability' (Power) of God to save.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from false security (~S1) to the reality of judgment (S2), then through the 'theological emergency' to the promise of God's sovereign return (S1) via redemptive suffering (~S2).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God resolves the tension by acting 'for his own sake' when the people are at their most impotent.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; exile is treated as a total catastrophe, not a minor setback.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor who initiates judgment and salvation. Human effort is shown to be futile against the 'Opponent' (Babylon/Idols).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Imagine that we refuse to play the games... We are like Daniel

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I, even I, am he who blots out your transgressions for my own sake
The real problem is that they cannot save. They have no power.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Daniel and the remnant are used as models of prayer, but they are quickly subsumed by the 'Unknown Prophet' through whom God speaks directly.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides this by moving from Daniel's prayer to God's sovereign declaration in Isaiah.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and relief from the burden of self-salvation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; salvation is a 'new thing' God does.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'theological emergency' to the 'Suffering Servant' is masterfully handled.
spanning_punten: The shift from Salisbury's local tragedy to the cosmic scale of Isaiah.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord has laid on him the iniquity of us all

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is not explicitly named, but the 'Word of God' acts as the empowering force.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total; it leads to the destruction of the city and the Temple.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The 'Opponent' is sufficiently powerful to necessitate a Divine Subject.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is the core of a grace-oriented sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly intensified through the Las Vegas/Babylon analogy.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's return) → Ethics (Light to the nations).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A model of theocentric preaching that uses narrative structure to strip the hearer of self-reliance and point to the sovereign mercy of God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the Salisbury/Las Vegas analogy, Greimasian analysis shows this analogy serves to establish the 'Opponent's' power and the 'Subject's' necessity.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond explaining the history of 587 BC to show how the 'functional role' of God as Redeemer is the engine of the text.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Suffering Servant' acts as a 'Helper' that allows the 'Subject' (God) to reach the 'Object' (Redemption) without violating His role as 'Sender' (Judge).

volledige_subject_lijst: God (hurls, accepts, prepares, blots out, remembers, redeems)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Moralistic Gap' by ensuring that the 'highway in the desert' is built by God, not by human repentance.
